title: Unable to run LoL After Graphics Card Change
body:
My graphics card died on me so I've removed it and am going to do some shopping around to get a new one; until then I'm using what I have in my motherboard which in an intel 4000. According to diagnostics and google this should be more than enough to run LoL, it supports shader 5.0 and my DirectX is version 10. However when I load into a game it immediately crashes my computer. On howling abyss in game timer gets to one second on SR doesn't even last that long. I went through the wrenchmen's tools and reduced my graphics settings to bare minimum but no change. I'm guessing something with my computer is still set from when I was using my AMD graphics card but I didn't have any custom settings for league and I already reduced my graphics settings to minimum with the wrenchmen's tool thing. Any ideas as to what I could do to get the game to run since I should more than meet the minimum requirements? Or will I just have to wait until I get a new graphics card? System specs below:

replies.body:
A recent Windows 10 update has caused the [Xbox Game Bar ](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) to crash when League is loaded.  Disabling that will probably fix this!  

These crashes could also be happening for a number of reasons, like outdated drivers or corrupt files.  Go over our [game crash](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes+) to get this fixed up, starting with drivers as it's usually a common issue.  You can also use our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) to help complete some of the processes in that guide.  Let me know if you have any issues afterwards!
